result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Joseph Corbine

records.addlTxt: DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty Chapman acknowledged receipt of information.  DEF entered NG plea.  Continues to Plea Sentencing.

Atty Chapman indicates DEF waives preliminary.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.   Moves to Arraignment.

11:04 AM Defendant Brandon Joseph Corbine in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Brandon Joseph Corbine.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.   State recites agreement, All parties agree. (Withheld sentence:  3 years probation:  Absolute Sobriety, AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Court Costs)   Moves to waiver of preliminary hearing and arraignment.    Court reviews filed information and DEF enters NC Plea.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.    Court orders long form PSI based on request of the DEF, and sets a sentencing hearing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:03 PM Defendant Brandon Joseph Corbine in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Brandon Joseph Corbine.   Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:11 PM Defendant Brandon Joseph Corbine in court.  Attorney Daniel Chapman appears in court.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  
Parties may appear by zoom for the next hearing.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 11:22 AM Defendant Brandon Joseph Corbine in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak (special appearance)  appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.     DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.   Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.   DEF waives times for preliminary hearing.  Court sets bond SIBS $2500  Combined Bond 22CF19 and 22CM11.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.   DEF to report to jail for fingerprints.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
